title: 109_hr383
content: The Ice Age Floods National Geologic Route Designation Act of 2006 designates a route in Montana, Idaho, Washington, and Oregon for public viewing and learning about the Ice Age Floods' features. The Ice Age Floods National Geologic Route Designation Act of 2006 defines key terms such as "Route" and "Secretary" and describes the cataclysmic floods that occurred in the northwestern United States during the last Ice Age. The Act designates the Ice Age Floods National Geologic Route in Montana, Idaho, Washington, and Oregon for public viewing and learning about these historic floods. The Ice Age Floods National Geologic Route is designated to provide public appreciation and education about significant natural and cultural sites associated with Ice Age Floods. The Route follows public roads from Missoula, Montana, through Idaho, Washington, and Oregon. The Ice Age Floods National Geologic Route spans from Washington to Oregon, as depicted on a map. The Secretary may revise the map as needed in cooperation with various entities. Maps are available for public inspection. Within 3 years of funding availability, a description of sites and interpretive program plan must be developed. After funds become available, the Secretary will prepare a description of sites along the Ice Age Floods National Geologic Route, including unique features, cultural resources, and an interpretive program plan. This will be transmitted to relevant congressional committees for review. Consultation will be conducted on the description of sites and plan. The Secretary will prepare a description of sites along the Ice Age Floods National Geologic Route in consultation with various stakeholders, including federal agencies, states, local governments, tribal governments, private citizens, and nonprofit organizations. SEC. 5. ADMINISTRATION. The Secretary will administer a program to interpret the Route, provide public education through technical assistance, and ensure the Route is marked with appropriate markers. The Secretary may erect signs displaying the Ice Age Floods National Geologic Route marker with assistance from relevant authorities. Private property rights are not affected by this Act, and property owners are not required to allow public access. Authorization of appropriations for the Secretary to carry out the Act is set at $250,000 per fiscal year.
